content: May 4(Reuters) - German fashion house Hugo Boss on Thursday raised its full-year operating profit guidance after reporting a double-digit jump in first-quarter sales.

The company expects its operating profit (EBIT) to grow between 10% and 20% to reach a level of 370 million to 400 million euros ($410 million to $443 million) in 2023, compared to the previously expected 5% to 12% growth.Analysts had forecast an EBIT of 377 million euros for 2023 in a poll provided by the company. ($1 = 0.9023 euros) (Reporting by Linda Pasquini and Elizaveta Gladun in Gdansk; Editing by Milla Nissi)
